{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3342208,"name":"","username":"Tedzzy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T01:14:26.064Z","cooked":"

I recently discovered this sandwich material, combining plastic and aluminum in one plate.

This is just the best option for lightweight, cheap, and durable applications.

Aluminum Composite Materials (ACM) | Laird Plastics

(For Chinese teams)
吉祥铝塑板厂家直供 4mm厚适用于门头广告室内外幕墙干挂-淘宝网 (taobao.com)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T01:14:26.064Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":180,"readers_count":179,"score":126.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459951,"topic_slug":"aluminum-composite-material-plate","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://lairdplastics.com/categories/aluminum-composite-panels-acm.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Aluminum Composite Materials (ACM) | Laird Plastics","clicks":60},{"url":"https://item.taobao.com/item.htm?id=768255087380&spm=a1z0d.6639537/tb.1997196601.4.3d385886c168gs","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5737→9411→10558"},"post_url":"/t/aluminum-composite-material-plate/459951/1","custom_user_title":"5737→9411→10558","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3342220,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T01:24:46.596Z","cooked":"

ACM…

This is commonly used in the sign industry. It’s relatively light weight, easy to cut with a router, band saw, step bits. You may be able to use it for prototyping for these properties.

It is NOT durable for FRC, at least in 3mm thicknesses, 6mm likely wouldn’t fair much better.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T01:31:14.447Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":48.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459951,"topic_slug":"aluminum-composite-material-plate","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/aluminum-composite-material-plate/459951/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342226,"name":"Frank Lima","username":"franklima260","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/franklima260/{size}/4291_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T01:29:15.438Z","cooked":"

It works fine if you structurally only need ~1/16" of aluminum but want a better bearing seat or similar application. The issue I have found with ACM is that the aluminum is not boned well enough to the plastic core, the result is that you delamination during bending loads.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T01:34:34.773Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459951,"topic_slug":"aluminum-composite-material-plate","display_username":"Frank Lima","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12457,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1745 Mentor | REV Robotics M.E."},"post_url":"/t/aluminum-composite-material-plate/459951/3","custom_user_title":"1745 Mentor | REV Robotics M.E.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342254,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T02:10:25.170Z","cooked":"

Also can be cut with a utility knife given some care. It’s extremely workable and given a reasonable amount of support can be quite stiff.

But if you’re using it for major structure, then you’re doing it wrong. It’ll bend if you tap it too hard, and the kind of hits an FRC robot takes are likely to put serious hurt on it.

I am planning to use this as our bottom plate and top plate since these generally do not experience heavy weights and impact. It’s not going to be a part that would be a major structure
